title: Marketplace for Thursday, January 8, 2015
byline: Stan Alcorn, Noel King, D Gorenstein, Kai Ryssdal, Nancy Marshall-Genzer and Stephanie Joyce
description: Airing on Thursday, January 8, 2015: Obama pushes a plan to lower some mortgage premiums by $900 a year. What does that mean for the housing market? Plus, we look at the evolution of the 40-hour workweek in light of a Republican push to define "full-time employment" for the purpose of health insurance eligibility under the Affordable Care Act. Finally, cheaper versions of biologics – drugs made out of living cells – could hit the market soon. We run the numbers.

Finally, cheaper versions of biologics – drugs made out of living cells – could hit the market soon. We run the numbers.
